Articles.Content: [http://goo.gl/Yky9Ap](**Kerbal Attachment System** introduces new mechanics into Kerbal Space Program. The mod adds containers, winches, struts, pipes and much more for use by your brave Kerbalnauts on EVA. The mod listing on Curse shows an impressive array of possible uses for all this including resource transfer, off-world base construction, parts storing and elevators. Give your game a boost with this landmark mod!

Yeah this has been featured several times before. Heck, I think it was the first modding monday.
Also, the modders are on the cusp of releasing Kerbal Inventory System which would have made a far better choice seeing as it's new and does a lot of the things KAS does (but better).
It actually gives astronauts something to do, which is nice.

KAS is one of the most fun mods I know of. Building a *Flight of the Phoenix*-style contraption out of parts leftover from your own crashed ship to get home is a unique challenge. Erecting a tower using the winch is pretty awesome too.

Recently, I used KAS to experiment with artificial gravity. (Inspired by Mars Direct) The onboard instruments only show the average acceleration of the whole vessel, but it was fun to mess with the concepts anyway. Unfortunately, KSP isn't designed for this, so some of the torques don't work as they should. After a while, I replaced the cable with a pipe, which made it behave more naturally.

On-topic - I think I was playing with mods for a little while before KAS fell onto my radar, so you can't assume that *everybody* has heard of it - the main audience for modding mondays may be the players who are seeing this on *facebook*, rather than the official forums or the official reddit.

Still - personally I agree, I'd rather see the new mods on modding monday. It gives them nice exposure (and there's a higher chance that one of mine get featured then ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)).
